subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] posted earlier_An incident that may be a concern
author: Carol B.
full_text:
Bruce,
I, for one, appreciate the post.  I am new to this research, but not new
to paranormal investigations.  I can see where the stated content would be
of a concern to many...including myself.  Actually, I had suspected that
this research may, indeed, create a passageway.  How could it not? 
Anyway, I thank you for the post.

Carol B.











> okay, okay!
>
> Lets put this to bed here and now.
> My post was not about fear or the acknowledgment of it.
> It was about the concerns of a new researcher!
>
> And no matter what anyone's opinion is regarding the subject matter,
> including my own.
>
> The concern was real to the person that experienced it.
> I felt that he would appreciate me addressing it publicly on the forum
> on the chance that other "NEW" researchers may have similar concerns.
>
> It was just what I posted it as "an incident that may be a concern"
>
> It is not a matter of fear or pushing any buttons, it's a matter of
> knowledge.
> Even if that knowledge is important to only one individual, that does
> not make it any less important.
>
> We have to remember that a lot of the new researchers and people
> getting interested in this field is due to the recent surge of
> publicity that we have gotten and all may not be seasoned paranormal
> veterans and adopted the philosophy of staring down the negative
> aspects of the paranormal.
>
> And I don't think that their education from any experienced
> researcher should include, if you ignore it that means it does not
> exist or can not affect any aspect of what we are doing.
>
> I don't want to open this whole can of worms again.
> If a new person voices a concern, and all concerns deserve to be
> addressed for the benefit of who ever needs it.
>
> My opinion on it or post about a certain incident is not meant to be
> the word of god or carved in stone. It is just what it is
> an opinion or a simple statement.
>
> Bruce
>
>
